abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Background</jats:title>
                <jats:p>Sudden sensorineural hearing loss (SSNHL) is an abrupt loss of hearing, still idiopathic in most of cases. Several mechanisms have been proposed including genetic and epigenetic interrelationships also considering iron homeostasis genes, ferroptosis and cellular stressors such as iron excess and dysfunctional mitochondrial superoxide dismutase activity.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Results</jats:title>
                <jats:p>We investigated 206 SSNHL patients and 420 healthy controls for the following genetic variants in the iron pathway: <jats:italic>SLC40A1</jats:italic> − 8CG (ferroportin; FPN1), <jats:italic>HAMP</jats:italic> − 582AG (hepcidin; HEPC), <jats:italic>HFE</jats:italic> C282Y and H63D (homeostatic iron regulator), <jats:italic>TF</jats:italic> P570S (transferrin) and <jats:italic>SOD2</jats:italic> A16V in the mitochondrial superoxide dismutase-2 gene. Among patients, <jats:italic>SLC40A1</jats:italic> − 8GG homozygotes were overrepresented (8.25% vs 2.62%; <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.0015) as well <jats:italic>SOD2</jats:italic> 16VV genotype (32.0% vs 24.3%; <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.037) accounting for increased SSNHL risk (OR = 3.34; 1.54–7.29 and OR = 1.47; 1.02–2.12, respectively). Moreover, LINE-1 methylation was inversely related (<jats:italic>r</jats:italic><jats:sup><jats:italic>2</jats:italic></jats:sup> = 0.042; <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.001) with hearing loss score assessed as pure tone average (PTA, dB HL), and the trend was maintained after <jats:italic>SLC40A1</jats:italic> − 8CG and <jats:italic>HAMP</jats:italic> − 582AG genotype stratification (Δ<jats:sub><jats:italic>SLC40A1</jats:italic></jats:sub> = + 8.99 dB HL and Δ<jats:sub><jats:italic>HAMP</jats:italic></jats:sub> = − 6.07 dB HL). In multivariate investigations, principal component analysis (PCA) yielded PC1 (PTA, age, LINE-1, <jats:italic>HAMP</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>SLC40A1</jats:italic>) and PC2 (sex, <jats:italic>HFE</jats:italic><jats:sub><jats:italic>C282Y</jats:italic></jats:sub>, <jats:italic>SOD2, HAMP</jats:italic>) among the five generated PCs, and logistic regression analysis ascribed to PC1 an inverse association with moderate/severe/profound HL (OR = 0.60; 0.42–0.86; <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.0006) and with severe/profound HL (OR = 0.52; 0.35–0.76; <jats:italic>P</jats:italic> = 0.001).</jats:p>
              </jats:sec><jats:sec>
                <jats:title>Conclusion</jats:title>
                <jats:p>Recognizing genetic and epigenetic biomarkers and their mutual interactions in SSNHL is of great value and can help pharmacy science to design by pharmacogenomic data classical or advanced molecules, such as epidrugs, to target new pathways for a better prognosis and treatment of SSNHL.</jats:p>
              </jats:sec>

group.label: Ethical approval and consent to participate
group.name: EthicsHeading

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: The study was performed in line with the principles of the Declaration of Helsinki. Approval was granted by the local ethics committee (DOR1759543/17). Informed consent was obtained from all individual participants included in the study.

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: All the authors declare no competing interests.

publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC

title: LINE-1 global DNA methylation, iron homeostasis genes, sex and age in sudden sensorineural hearing loss (SSNHL)
